{"step_by_step_thinking": "Carbamazepine is a medication used primarily in the treatment of epilepsy and neuropathic pain. It has several side effects. Steven-Johnson syndrome is a severe skin reaction that can occur as a side effect of carbamazepine. Agranulocytosis, a serious condition where the body does not have enough white blood cells, can also occur as a side effect of carbamazepine. Rash is a common side effect of many medications, including carbamazepine. However, blurred vision is not typically associated with carbamazepine use.", "answer_choice": "D"}
